intro: Bampsia lawalreeana, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Bampsia lawalreeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
